title: Michael Jackson – The KING of POP
snippet: How MJ’s innovation, vocals, and performance still define pop.
content:
Michael Jackson didn’t just top charts—he engineered a blueprint for pop stardom that still runs today. From sonic experimentation on “Thriller” to genre-bending visuals and choreography, MJ fused sound, spectacle, and storytelling into a single, global language.

His influence is audible in modern pop, R&B, and even K-pop staging. The critique is that his personal controversies overshadow the art; the counterpoint is that the artistic legacy remains singular.

title: Elden Ring – The Future of Open Worlds
snippet: FromSoftware turns exploration into pure discovery—no hand-holding.
content:
Elden Ring’s Lands Between feel authored yet feral. The map doesn’t nag—you’re trusted to wander, fail, and return smarter. Combat is deep, builds are expressive, and the world rewards curiosity.

The difficulty curve will lose some players, but that high friction is the secret sauce behind the high payoff.

title: Oppenheimer – Brains, Bombast, Burden
snippet: Nolan splices moral weight with bravura craft and sound.
content:
Cillian Murphy anchors a dense, morally charged drama that toggles between genius and guilt. The sound design and IMAX photography create a sensory gravity well.

It’s verbose and long—but the ambition sings, and the last act lingers.

title: Atomic Habits – Tiny Steps, Big Compounding
snippet: James Clear’s framework for stacking small wins into identity.
content:
Clear’s core loop—cue, craving, response, reward—packages behavioral science into tactics normal people can execute. Systems > goals; identity > outcomes.

It’s simple enough to apply tomorrow, though seasoned readers may find parts familiar.
cons: Repetitive if you’ve read similar books

title: Superman - Truth, Justice and a Better Tomorrow
snippet: Superman - Truth, Justice and a Better Tomorrow
content: A triumph return to form. This is the Superman we've been waiting for: soaring, hopeful epic that remind us why he's the world's greates superhero. Superman became another block buster hit for DC Studios following the success of Creature Commandoes months prior. The movie was not only good but it exceeded the expectation of it's last incarnation, Man of Steel which was a controversial movie and the launch of a failed universe that is the DCEU. James Gunn not only understood superman he understood the core concept of what it's means to be kind which is superman's number one trait, he also brought superman back to the bright and hopeful dork we all know and love contrast to the dark and gritty vibe of Zack Snyder. So we, the folks at ER give Superman 4/5 stars
pros: It displays the Core character of superman
Kindness is the new punk rock
